pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e86bdd33b0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20489/commits/e86bdd33b03aaa3ac7f752771ffacb1e131f5de4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Azumaya.Defs` (new file)|1051|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AlgHom.mulLeftRight`
`+ AlgHom.mulLeftRight_apply`
`+ IsAzumaya`
`+ instModuleTensorProductMop`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Could anyone help me with the bib I'm really confused with this :((

Take a look at other examples in mathlib to hopefully unconfuse yourself (this is a standard trick which computer scientists seem to learn very early in their career but which mathematicians have to pick up later on). For example the first entry in `references.bib` is `abramsky_gabbay_maibaum_1994` and if you search for that string in mathlib you'll see how it's referenced (see for example the file https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/master/Mathlib/Topology/Order/ScottTopology.lean ). If you also take a look in the API docs for mathlib for the files where that reference is mentioned e.g. https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Order/ScottTopology.html you can see how it displays nicely in the module docstring.
Please mark conversations as resolved once they are.
I think this PR is ready?
bors d+

:v: Whysoserioushah can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
If everyone's okay with this I'll merge it then?
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12948641847/job/36117708730)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12948641847/job/36117708381)
Is this map `R`-bilinear? You are lifting it some lines below, might as well make it a bilinear map here.
deleted
Is [Algebra.TensorProduct.lift](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/TensorProduct/Basic.html#Algebra.TensorProduct.lift) useful here

what about
```lean
noncomputable abbrev endo : (A [R] A) [R] Module.End R A :=
Algebra.TensorProduct.lift
  (Algebra.lsmul R R A) (Algebra.lsmul R R A)
  (by
    intro a b
    ext x
    simp [commute_iff_eq, mul_assoc])
```
changed

```suggestion
# Azumaya Algebras

```

```suggestion
An Azumaya algebra over a commutative ring `R` is a finitely generated, projective 
and faithful R-algebra
```
(and sort out pagination)
Can you add tags and references following the community guidelines for module docstrings here https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/doc.html ?
done!
This surely can't go in the root namespace, and it has a bad name: `endo` is not in the mathlib naming convention.
what name do you suggest I'm really bad at naming stuff :((
`Module.End.ofTensorProductMulOpposite` maybe?
Better yet, reuse `TensorProduct.Algebra.moduleAux` which is already almost exactly this definition
should I use the map to prove it as well?

```suggestion
where the tensor product `A [R] A` is isomorphic to the endomorphism ring of A `End R A`
```
Why not `extend` this too?
it gives an error I don't know why

It gives this error:
`parent field type mismatch, field 'out' from parent 'Module.Finite' has type
  .FG : Prop
but is expected to have type
   s, Function.LeftInverse (Finsupp.linearCombination R id) s : Prop`

The issue is that the fields of `Module.Projective` and `Module.Finite` are both called `out`. https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/too.20many.20.60out.60s/near/492051754 . This is fixed in #20506
#20506 is merged now, so you can merge master and then should be able to `extend` Module.Finite.
Done!
Can you list these other definitions in this to-do? It's hard to review if you've chosen the best one otherwise
sure thing will do
This should be added to `references.bib`
what's reference.bib
A file in mathlib (it's `docs/references.bib`)
done! (although not so sure whether to put wikipedia in the `bib` file)
Not doing so is correct; but on this line you should now reference the key you added.
how should I do that?

```suggestion
`R`-endomorphisms of A via the map `f : a  b  (x  a * x * b.unop)`.
```

```suggestion
TODO : Add three more definitions and prove they are equivalent:
```

```suggestion
class IsAzumaya extends Module.Projective R A, FaithfulSMul R A, Module.Finite R A : Prop where
```
This patch still needs to be applied.
Also: azumaya -> Azumaya in docstring.

This is no longer an auxiliary construction, unlike `moduleAux`. `AlgHom.tensorMopToEnd` could be a good name.
Maybe we should put a `A [R] A`-module ("bimodule") structure on A with a `IsScalarTower R (A [R] A) A` instance. Then this becomes a special case of the following:
```
import Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Hom
import Mathlib.Algebra.Module.LinearMap.End
def Module.toModuleEndAlgHom (R) {S} (M) [CommSemiring R] [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] 
    [Semiring S] [Module S M] [Algebra R S] [IsScalarTower R S M] :
    S [R] Module.End R M where
  __ := toModuleEnd R M
  commutes' r := by ext; apply algebraMap_smul
```
Done! but where should this definition go?
Apparently Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Hom already imports Mathlib.Algebra.Module.LinearMap.End, so it could go in the former.
that's weird because `lake exe shake --fix` didn't find this repeat import
`shake` doesn't complain if some declaration in Mathlib.Algebra.Module.LinearMap.End is used, which is the case here. #min_imports is the way to go to eliminate all transitive imports.
thanks!

```suggestion
variable (R A : Type*) [CommSemiring R] [Semiring A] [Algebra R A]
```
Presumably you didn't mean to delete these? I guess the `@Article` line goes below your `@Book` reference.
thanks, reverted!

Does it make sense to completely unbundle, i.e. make a class which only says `Function.Bijective <| TensorProduct.Algebra.moduleAux' R A`, something like this
```
class PreAzumaya where
  bij : ...
```
Then when one need Azumaya algerba, one declares `[Module.Projective R A] [FaithfulSMul R A] [Module.Finite R A] [PreAzumaya R A]`, so that a theorem could potentially be proved with fewer assumptions than `IsAzumaya`
Any examples that this version works better than the current one? I don't mind changing it though

For example, instead defining central simple algebra (which sometimes finite dimensionality is assumed), we have `Algebra.IsCentral` and `IsSimpleRing` and `FiniteDimensional` separately so that one can always pick whatever combination they like
Hmmm if that's the case, why don't we just not have this definition at all and just have `(h : Function.Bijective ...)` as well as the other assumptions?
In fact, why do we even have `class` when we can just list all the assumptions?
Doesn't this exist already as `Algebra.lsmul`?

Indeed, that's even more general, not sure why I didn't find it. It can be golfed with [Module.toModuleEnd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/LinearMap/End.html#Module.toModuleEnd) too.
wait so I should change this to `Algebra.lsmul`?

I think you can remove this def since
```
example (R) {S} (M) [CommSemiring R] [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M]
    [Semiring S] [Module S M] [Algebra R S] [IsScalarTower R S M] :
    S [R] Module.End R M :=
  Algebra.lsmul R R M
```
works.
okay!

I think it would be best if these were local not global instances; the first one I think puts a competing module structure on `Module (A [R] A) (A [R] A)`.

I think you could inline them with `letI` into the definition of `AlgHom.tensorMopToEnd`?

I think the Module instance should be local but the IsScalarTower instance need not be. Or make the Module instance an abbrev and `letI` it in both the IsScalarTower instance and the `bij` field in `class IsAzumaya`, similar to [IsScalarTower.ofAlgHom](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/6c0f299838250e5428d2e66f576d1a1babab088a/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Tower.lean#L164-L168) (I'm not sure why [RingHom.toAlgebra](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Defs.html#RingHom.toAlgebra) isn't an abbrev).
ok!
This should be `@[simp]`

```suggestion
  letI : Module (A [R] A) A := TensorProduct.Algebra.module
```
then you can drop the `abbrev` above too.

```suggestion
  author        = {Benson Farb, R. Keith Dennis},
```
I still think this can be an instance, but I wouldn't demand it.
I mean you and eric are giving different orders on this so... I guess I'll just leave this for now :((
This one can't be an instance without the module instance, and the module instance (probably) creates diamonds.
Perhaps it should be a theorem though about the `def` providing the module structure in the other file.
maybe put it in another PR will be appropriate?

> This one can't be an instance without the module instance, and the module instance (probably) creates diamonds.

I mean something like
```
instance : letI _ : Module (A [R] A) A := TensorProduct.Algebra.moduleAux
    IsScalarTower R (A [R] A) A :=
{ smul_assoc := fun r ab a  by
    change TensorProduct.Algebra.moduleAux _ _ = _  TensorProduct.Algebra.moduleAux _ _
    simp }
```
The main advantage would be that when you want to use this instance, you only need to `let` the Module instance into the environment, and then this IsScalarTower instance automatically applies. (If some lemmas assuming IsScalarTower switch to using {Module} instance of [Module], you may be able to avoid even introducing the Module instance.)
A good name for this would be `AlgHom.mulLeftRight`, which matches `LinearMap.mulLeftRight`
changed!

```suggestion
  `AlgHom.mulLeftRight R A : (A [R] A) [R] Module.End R A` is an isomorphism. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Azumaya/Defs): Define Azumaya algebras
